- Boundary conditions

  • Time - Independent Shrodinger equation
Eψ(x)+ℏ22md2ψ(x)dx2−V(x)ψ(x)=0E \psi(x)+\frac{\hbar^{2}}{2 m} \frac{d^{2} \psi(x)}{d x^{2}}-V(x) \psi(x)=0Eψ(x)+2mℏ2​dx2d2ψ(x)​−V(x)ψ(x)=0

ψl(x)=Aeikx+Be−ikx;x<−a (left region) ψm(x)=Ceηx+De−ηx;−a<x<a (middle region) ψr(x)=Feikx+Ge−ikx;x>a (left region) \begin{array}{ll}{\psi_{l}(x)=A e^{i k x}+B e^{-i k x} ;} & {x<-a \text { (left region) }} \\ {\psi_{m}(x)=C e^{\eta x}+D e^{-\eta x} ;} & {-a<x<a \text { (middle region) }} \\ {\psi_{r}(x)=F e^{i k x}+G e^{-i k x} ;} & {x>a \text { (left region) }}\end{array}ψl​(x)=Aeikx+Be−ikx;ψm​(x)=Ceηx+De−ηx;ψr​(x)=Feikx+Ge−ikx;​x<−a (left region) −a<x<a (middle region) x>a (left region) ​

With

k=2mEℏ,η=2m(E−V0)ℏk=\frac{\sqrt{2 m E}}{\hbar}, \eta=\frac{\sqrt{2 m\left(E-V_{0}\right)}}{\hbar}k=ℏ2mE​​,η=ℏ2m(E−V0​)​​

For 0 < 𝐸 < V0V_{0}V0​ , both 𝑘 and 𝜂 are real numbers.

Provided we choose the constants A-G such, that the function ψ(x)\psi(x)ψ(x) is continuous and differentiable everywhere, it will be a solution to the Schrodinger equation for all 𝑥, including the boundaries 𝑥 = ±𝑎.

  • Continuity of 𝜓 𝑥 at 𝑥 = −𝑎 gives the relation
Aeika+Be−ika=Ceηa+De−ηaA e^{i k a}+B e^{-i k a}=C e^{\eta a}+D e^{-\eta a}Aeika+Be−ika=Ceηa+De−ηa

, whereas continuity of ddxψ(x)\frac{d}{d x} \psi(x)dxd​ψ(x) at 𝑥 = −𝑎 gives

ikAeika−ikBe−ika=ηCeηa−ηDe−ηai k A e^{i k a}-i k B e^{-i k a}=\eta C e^{\eta a}-\eta D e^{-\eta a}ikAeika−ikBe−ika=ηCeηa−ηDe−ηa

Transmission of a 1D potential barrier

  • Matrix equation: (AB)=M(1)(CD)\left(\begin{array}{l}{A} \\ {B}\end{array}\right)=M^{(1)}\left(\begin{array}{l}{C} \\ {D}\end{array}\right)(AB​)=M(1)(CD​)
M(1)=((ik+η2ik)e(ik−η)a(ik−η2ik)e(ik+η)a(ik−η2ik)e−(ik+η)a(ik+η2ik)e−(ik−η)a)M^{(1)}=\left(\begin{array}{ll}{\left(\frac{i k+\eta}{2 i k}\right) e^{(i k-\eta) a}} & {\left(\frac{i k-\eta}{2 i k}\right) e^{(i k+\eta) a}} \\ {\left(\frac{i k-\eta}{2 i k}\right) e^{-(i k+\eta) a}} & {\left(\frac{i k+\eta}{2 i k}\right) e^{-(i k-\eta) a}}\end{array}\right)M(1)=⎝⎛​(2ikik+η​)e(ik−η)a(2ikik−η​)e−(ik+η)a​(2ikik−η​)e(ik+η)a(2ikik+η​)e−(ik−η)a​⎠⎞​

In a similar way, continuity of ψ(x)\psi(x)ψ(x) and ddxψ(x)\frac{d}{d x} \psi(x)dxd​ψ(x) at 𝑥 = 𝑎 gives the matrix equation

(CD)=M(2)(FG)\left(\begin{array}{l}{C} \\ {D}\end{array}\right)=M^{(2)}\left(\begin{array}{l}{F} \\ {G}\end{array}\right)(CD​)=M(2)(FG​)

Where the matrix M(2)M^{(2)}M(2) can be obtained from M(1)M^{(1)}M(1) by replacing −𝑎 by 𝑎, 𝑖𝑘 by 𝜂 and 𝜂 by 𝑖𝑘.

∴(AB)=M(FG)M=M(1)M(2)\begin{array}{l}{\therefore\left(\begin{array}{l}{A} \\ {B}\end{array}\right)=M\left(\begin{array}{l}{F} \\ {G}\end{array}\right)} \\ {M=M^{(1)} M^{(2)}}\end{array}∴(AB​)=M(FG​)M=M(1)M(2)​
  • Probability current, 𝐽:
Jin−JR=JT⇔Jin=JR+JTJ_{i n}-J_{R}=J_{T} \quad \Leftrightarrow \quad J_{i n}=J_{R}+J_{T}Jin​−JR​=JT​⇔Jin​=JR​+JT​

Jin,JR′J_{i n}, J_{R \prime}Jin​,JR′​, and JTJ_{T}JT​ is incident, reflected, and transmitted currents, respectively.

  • Transmission coefficient, 𝑇:
T=JTJin=ℏkm∣F∣2hkm∣A∣2=∣F∣2∣A∣2=∣1M11∣2∴T=[1+(k2+η22kη)sinh⁡2(2ηa)]−1\begin{array}{l}{T=\frac{J_{T}}{J_{i n}}=\frac{\frac{\hbar k}{m}|F|^{2}}{\frac{h k}{m}|A|^{2}}=\frac{|F|^{2}}{|A|^{2}}=\left|\frac{1}{M_{11}}\right|^{2}} \\ {\therefore T=\left[1+\left(\frac{k^{2}+\eta^{2}}{2 k \eta}\right) \sinh ^{2}(2 \eta a)\right]^{-1}}\end{array}T=Jin​JT​​=mhk​∣A∣2mℏk​∣F∣2​=∣A∣2∣F∣2​=∣∣∣​M11​1​∣∣∣​2∴T=[1+(2kηk2+η2​)sinh2(2ηa)]−1​

frontmatter.description: EDISON 사이언스 앱을 활용하여 1차원 potential barrier에 입사하는 plane wave의 transmission에 대한 이해
frontmatter.title: 1차원 potential barrier에 입사하는 plane wave의 transmission에 대한 이해
